metadata.titel_preek: Lent and Holy Week: Ash Wednesday and First Sunday in Lent

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of universal sin and self-deception to justify and recreate the sinner through the substitutionary death of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has shown us a great thing.
There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
make a completely new person out of the sinner

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Reality of God's Holiness
tekstueel_bewijs: the holiness of God, who has the absolute right to make demands and render judgments

ontvanger.identificatie: The Unrighteous / The Enemies of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the salvation of each and every one of us
Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power / Self-Deception / The Sentence of Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the storm of the wrath of God against sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is treated not as a mistake but as a condition that requires a 'Subject-switch' to Christ because humans are 'helpless'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and honest self-inventory.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher explicitly states that the knowledge of grace precedes the confession of sin.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has shown us a great thing.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
God sees you as you really are.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We throw ourselves on his mercy.
We do not need to surround ourselves with defenses.

voorbeelden: the most honest assessment... that we can possibly offer him
We do not need to live out an exhausting... charade.
The recognition of sin comes as the psalmist is confronted.
God is truly able to do away with sin.
While we were still helpless, Christ died.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (helplessness) and God's absolute 'pouvoir' (ability) to save.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the realization of S2 (Judgment) to the exposure of ~S1 (Pretense), finally resolving in S1 (Grace) because Christ occupied S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary atonement: Christ takes the 'sentence' (S2) to grant 'righteousness' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'storm of wrath' is not minimized but redirected.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor in the salvation event and treats human response as a fruit of grace rather than a condition for it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our two greatest presidents... called the nation to repentance.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The psalmist is used as a 'witness' to the human condition rather than a hero to be imitated by effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The psalmist is a recipient of insight, not a hero of virtue.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; justification by faith alone.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Ash Wednesday' self-inventory to the 'First Sunday' cosmic mercy is perfectly integrated via the cross.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an offense against God that humans cannot 'un-do'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is theologically appropriate for Lent.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Wrath) is already presented as insurmountable by humans.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'Lenten Moralism' by making the depth of sin the very reason for the necessity of God's exclusive agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Tolkien/Solzhenitsyn as 'ethos', Greimasian analysis shows they serve to define the 'Opponent' as universal.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Psalm; this analysis reveals the 'engine' of the sermon is the Subject-switch from the Psalmist to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'charade' is a modal failure of 'Savoir' and 'Pouvoir' which only the 'Sender' (God) can rectify.

appendices.notities: The sermon adheres strictly to the Rutledge Rule.
